text: We'll hear argument now on number oh one seven fourteen, Utah versus Donald L Evans, Secretary of Commerce.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Mr. Lee, I I would like to ask you to address early on whether this injury that Utah alleges to have suffered is redressable in any fashion.
I I suppose, Justice O'Connor, that there are two aspects of your question if I'm understanding it.
jurisdiction, but I don't know that we have really addressed the redressability issue fully in prior cases.
It it would have been impossible, Justice O'Connor, for Utah to have brought a challenge prior to the census.

May it please the Court, because North Carolina believes s- very strongly that the right time to challenge the Census Bureau's planned use of a statistical method is before rather than after the census is completed, and let me begin...
The honorable court is now adjourned until Monday next at ten o'clock.
